web service allows creating a new workflow template.<br><br>A workflow template defines a succession of any WMC eligible web services. These web services are grouped by entity types (workflowGroups):<br><ul><li>GATEWAY (web service concerning gateways)</li><li>END_DEVICE (web service concerning end-devices)</li></ul>A workflow template can be executed on many entities and must contain only web services of the same group.<br><br>In order to create a worflow template, you must be familiar with the BPMN 2.0 standard and respect the following rules.<br><br><b>Tasks definition</b><br><br>Each web service of a workflow template corresponds to a step and is composed of two tasks chained by a \"sequenceFlow\":<br><ol><li>A \"userTask\" which calls the web service. This task must set the following assignee attribute: <pre>activiti:assignee=\"workflowStepExecutor\"</pre></li><li>A \"userTask\" which checks the previous task result. This task must set the following assignee attribute: <pre>activiti:assignee=\"tasksStatusCheck\"</pre></li></ol>Any other value will lead to a step failure at execution time!<br><br><b>Tasks content</b><br><br><i>\"userTask\" - Web service</i><br><br>This \"userTask\" must define the following \"formProperty\" (with \"id\" and \"name\" attributes equals to):<br><ul><li>\"webService\", corresponds to the web service path. Example:<pre<activiti:formProperty id=\"webService\" name=\"webService\" type=\"string\" variable=\"/application/gateways/{eui}/control\" writable=\"false\" required=\"true\"></activiti:formProperty></pre></li><li>\"httpMethod\", corresponds to the web service method {GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE}. Example: <pre><activiti:formProperty id=\"httpMethod\" name=\"httpMethod\" type=\"string\" variable=\"PATCH\" writable=\"false\" required=\"true\"></activiti:formProperty></pre></li><li>\"wsType\", corresponds to the web service type {synchronous, asynchronous}. Example: <pre><activiti:formProperty id=\"wsType\" name=\"wsType\" type=\"string\" variable=\"synchronous\" writable=\"false\" required=\"true\"></activiti:formProperty></pre></li><li>\"argType\", corresponds to the type of the parameters {string, dto}. Example: <pre><activiti:formProperty id=\"argType\" name=\"argType\" type=\"string\" variable=\"dto\" writable=\"false\" required=\"true|false\"></activiti:formProperty></pre></li></ul>A synchronous task can reply with a \"link\". This link will automatically be called at the end of the step execution to retrieve the result and the associated DTO.<br>An asynchronous task sends back a TaskDto (WMC way). This so called TaskDto will be reused to determine the task progression as well as the result.<br><br>This task must also define the request parameters of the web service as \"formProperty\" like this: <pre><activiti:formProperty id=\"command\" name=\"command\" type=\"String\" writable=\"false\" required=\"true\"></activiti:formProperty></pre><br><br>If a web service requires a DTO, each field of the DTO must be defined as \"formProperty\" like the request parameters. Example: <pre><activiti:formProperty id=\"cpuAlarmThreshold\" name=\"cpuAlarmThreshold\" type=\"integer\" writable=\"false\"></activiti:formProperty></pre><br><br>If a web service requres a file, the task must define a \"formProperty\" like this: <pre><activiti:formProperty id=\"file\" name=\"file\" type=\"MultipartFile\" writable=\"false\" required=\"true\"></activiti:formProperty></pre><br><br><i>\"userTask\" - Result check</i><br><br>This \"userTask\" must stay empty.<br><br><b>Tasks chaining</b><br><br>You can chain steps with \"sequenceFlow\".<br>You can also use the response of \"userTask\" - result check to make conditions. This result is a boolean \"result\" equals to true if the previous \"userTask\" web service succeed, false otherwise.<br><br>Since: v3.1.0<br><br>Role ?
